channel.title: Clickable button ids 317 PI
channel.description:
hi! I need to disable the numbers shown below next to button name. Clickable buttons IDs. Any clue?
EDIT: It shows with all buttons, not just magic spellbook.
[img]http://i.gyazo.com/cccf9575ec9c749f990421f944107820.png[/img]
Thanks.

item.title: Clickable button ids 317 PI
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“CoderOops, post:10, topic:549244”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=668150.msg4470195#msg4470195 date=1422562501]

usally this only happens if your a mod+ its so they can id certain things and normal people it doesn’t usually look like that.

And again, that is in the code as well. It would say:
if(myPrivledges >= 1)
// The code that shows the id
else
// The one without the id.
[/quote]

That’s the problem. Visible for everyone.[/quote]

Then refer to my previous post:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:549244”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=668150.msg4469646#msg4469646 date=1422275028]
This is client sided, search for something like “cast” "@gre@cast
at the end of the line there will be a variable which is displaying the id so if you take that away you’ll be good
[/quote]
I actually believe the “Cast” string is applied dynamically, so you wouldn’t find it…

OP look for something similar to:

if (class9_1.atActionType == 2 && spellSelected == 0 && k >= i2 && i1 >= j2 && k < i2 + class9_1.width && i1 < j2 + class9_1.height) { String s = class9_1.selectedActionName; if (s.indexOf(" ") != -1) s = s.substring(0, s.indexOf(" ")); menuActionName[menuActionRow] = s + " @gre@" + class9_1.spellName; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 626; menuActionCmd3[menuActionRow] = class9_1.id; menuActionRow++; }
And the part you need to change would be:

menuActionName[menuActionRow] = s + " @gre@" + class9_1.spellName;[/quote]

Seriously search the text: menuActionName[menuActionRow] =
And look around. You shouldn’t be having an issue finding a simple string and removing a single object from it…

How I found the text was I actually used RandQm’s method of searching “@gre@”.
But, there are multiple matches. I happen to know which does what in a un-renamed client, so that’s why I gave you the full string to look for.

Read full topic

item.title: Clickable button ids 317 PI
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:549244”][quote author=osbodav link=topic=668150.msg4470175#msg4470175 date=1422548968]
usally this only happens if your a mod+ its so they can id certain things and normal people it doesn’t usually look like that.
[/quote]
And again, that is in the code as well. It would say:
if(myPrivledges >= 1)
// The code that shows the id
else
// The one without the id.[/quote]

That’s the problem. Visible for everyone.

Read full topic

item.title: Clickable button ids 317 PI
item.dc:creator: @CoderOops CoderOops
item.description:
@CoderOops wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:6, topic:549244”][quote author=CoderOops link=topic=668150.msg4469864#msg4469864 date=1422381720]
It is for all button, not just spells. Took teleport button as example. Sorry for confusing XD…

Any ideas?
[/quote]

[quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=668150.msg4469709#msg4469709 date=1422304908]

This is client sided, search for something like “cast” "@gre@cast
at the end of the line there will be a variable which is displaying the id so if you take that away you’ll be good

I actually believe the “Cast” string is applied dynamically, so you wouldn’t find it…

OP [size=18pt]look for something similar[/size] to:

if (class9_1.atActionType == 2 && spellSelected == 0 && k >= i2 && i1 >= j2 && k < i2 + class9_1.width && i1 < j2 + class9_1.height) { String s = class9_1.selectedActionName; if (s.indexOf(" ") != -1) s = s.substring(0, s.indexOf(" ")); menuActionName[menuActionRow] = s + " @gre@" + class9_1.spellName; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 626; menuActionCmd3[menuActionRow] = class9_1.id; menuActionRow++; }
And the part you need to change would be:

menuActionName[menuActionRow] = s + " @gre@" + class9_1.spellName;
[/quote][/quote]

Did check but did not find anything. It is generally for all buttons, not just mage.

Read full topic

This is client sided, search for something like “cast” "@gre@cast
at the end of the line there will be a variable which is displaying the id so if you take that away you’ll be good

I actually believe the “Cast” string is applied dynamically, so you wouldn’t find it…

if (class9_1.atActionType == 2 && spellSelected == 0 && k >= i2 && i1 >= j2 && k < i2 + class9_1.width && i1 < j2 + class9_1.height) { String s = class9_1.selectedActionName; if (s.indexOf(" ") != -1) s = s.substring(0, s.indexOf(" ")); menuActionName[menuActionRow] = s + " @gre@" + class9_1.spellName; menuActionID[menuActionRow] = 626; menuActionCmd3[menuActionRow] = class9_1.id; menuActionRow++; }
